modules.description: This module outputs 2D mesh data to LaTeX using PGF commands, primarily for rendering in TikZ environments. It provides functions to save meshes, level curves, and sub/super-level sets using customizable macros like `\meshline`, `\meshpoint`, and `\meshtriangle`, with support for color-coded visualization. Concrete use cases include generating high-quality mesh diagrams and visualizing finite element method (FEM) results directly in LaTeX documents.

The module represents and manipulates 2D and 3D meshes using point and triangle arrays, supporting operations like indexing, sub-mesh extraction, permutation, and Cuthill-McKee reordering to reduce bandwidth. It includes functions for computing mesh band height, exporting data to visualization tools like Scilab and MATLAB, and handling memory layouts (C or Fortran). A child module extends functionality by exporting 2D meshes to LaTeX via PGF/TikZ, enabling high-quality visualizations with customizable macros for lines, points, and triangles. This combination supports tasks from numerical simulation preprocessing to detailed FEM result rendering in documents.
